@jancborchardt please review the delay + styling of the "wait mask"
you can make it appear by adding a sleep() call in getfiles() in helper.php or using a slow server.

@pvince81 can you please rebase
tested on chromium :+1:
could someone test with ie? otherwise :+1:

observations on ie8 test:
- [x] animated spinner during loading is displayed tiled across the whole page
- [x] home icon is not loaded - most probably the svg fallback is not proper working
- [x] breadcrumb separators are not shown as well

@kabum can you please test and review this? thx
@pvince81 any solution at hand regarding ie8 and url manipulation - jquery bbq maybe?

ie8 only supports changing the url and detecting its changes when using a hash (which seem to be covered by jquery bbq)

it means there is more extra non-trivial work needed to adapt the url to either:
1) support either hashes or the current format
or
2) always work with hashes, in which case it also needs to be backward compatible (in case people saved/bookmarked urls)

the url with hash could look like ..../files.php?#dir=/somedir/somesubdir or .../files.php#?dir=/somedir/somesubdir
i expect this would need many changes in the php part as well, to convert urls from one format to the other.

when discussing this with @jancborchardt he suggested to not support this for ie8 at all, which means disabling ajax support for ie8 completely (which could still be addressed in a later pr/issue).

what do you think ?
@deepdiver1975 i agree. it's probably a performance gain for ie8 users as well.

just had a look at putting the url query string into hashes for ie8.
i've pushed a prototype version on the branch "ajaxfilelist-ie8".
when starting with the root dir, everything works fine, you can navigate and the url will change. using the browser previous/next buttons also work.

however, there are the following issues:
1) if the ie8 user got a link from a non-ie8 user, like "files.php?dir=somedir", the page will appear fine initially. then, when the ie8 user navigates, we can only change the hash part, so this will make the url ugly like "files.php?dir=somedir#?dir=somesubdir" (changing the part before the hash would reload the whole page)

2) if the ie8 user opens a subdir url directly by pasting it in, like "files.php#?dir=somedir", the hash part is never sent to the server (technical limitation). so the server will always return the contents of the root dir.
the workaround i put in the js code (filelist.js:initfromhash()) is to directlty change the directory after load (there is a little delay)
this means there will be some loading overhead, which depends on the size of the root dir.
another solution would be to make the files app "full ajax" which means that when opening a dir, the index.php will return the list container without file list, then let the js code load the initial file list.

apart for this it seems to work fine.

any thoughts on this ?

> i've pushed a prototype version on the branch "ajaxfilelist-ie8".

awesome!

let's divide and conquer!

we ignore ie8 on this pr, merge it asap and work on a ie8 solution on your second branch for a different pr.

@karlitschek @jancborchardt any objections?

if we leave this pr as is, the only drawback when using ie8 will be that if the user refreshes the page, they will land on whatever page the browser pointed at before they started navigating. (just for information)
i have no objections, except that i still need to test it tomorrow and will probably have one or two nitpicks :)
looks like we're also missing the "directory permission" update, including the "ispublic" attribute.

ok, now the permissions are updated and the display "you don't have write permissions" will be toggled appropriately.

the only thing i still didn't understand is what "ispublic" is for. it seems to be true only in the files_sharing app, in public.php,  which never seems to be called directly, even when opening shared folders. any clue ? (i guess it might be old code)

looks good!

the only issue i see right now that when youâ€™re in some subfolder (the breadcrumb is there) and you open a text document with the editor, clicking on an element in the breadcrumb will not close the editor. it should close the editor and move you to that folder.
@pvince81 @jancborchardt can you please take care to get this sorted out? i'm on vacation next week - thx

this needs a rebase.

gave it a quick test in chromium: neat!

rebased. now we can see the nice big icons and previews :-)

will look into the other issues next.

* [x] scroll down, open a folder -> loading mask is just fixed to the top and therefore just overlaps the upper part and not the whole viewport

tested in ie8, firefox 23, chromium 28, android browser (i used "next", but it's the same rendering engine for all browsers on android)
@pvince81 already needs another rebase. ;)

@kabum fixed the mask position issue.
@jancborchardt rebased.

test passed.
refer to this link for build results: https://ci.owncloud.org/job/pull-request-analyser/883/

__tldr; ie8 fix talk below__

i have prepared fixes for ie8, but i'd rather have this pr merged first, as the ie8 is a different story.

the ie8 fix makes use of url hashes, meaning that the url can either have "?dir=/path" or "#?dir=/path" and can be used in both ie8 and non-ie8 browsers.

for the hashes to work seamlessly in ie8, additional changes are needed on the server side, for which there are two alternatives:
1) make index.php never return a file list, and make the file list loading ajax-only. this currently breaks the files_sharing app which is not ajaxified yet (i plan to do it as a separate pr later)
you can find it on the __ajaxfilelist-ie8__ branch.

or

2) do the behaviour of 1) only for ie8, which means that index.php and its template is still able to return files as before. this seemed to work best.
you can find it on the __ajaxfilelist-ie8-alternative__

i'd also like to know whether "dir" is the only url argument we'll ever need in the files* apps because that one needs to work with having the hash as well.

test passed.
refer to this link for build results: https://ci.owncloud.org/job/pull-request-analyser/891/

i guess something such as openfile would be good as well, to also store the
file which is open via the detail view.

but next to the address, these values should be stored in the browser also
so people's current state will be preserved.

@pvince81 can i ask you to rebase this once more? thx

rebased.

i'll soon put my ie8 fixes on top of this as well, from ajaxfilelist-ie8-alternative.
that will make ie8 work with a hash url. i hope this solution is good enough.
without this, the feature isn't complete as it doesn't update the url in ie8 and makes it tricky for a user to copy the current directory's url (for bookmarking for example) or refreshing the page.
